item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, January 28, 2025 at 2:40 AM UTC
item.description:
1. We're bringing Pebble back (1305 points | 341 comments)
2. Machine Learning in Production (CMU Course) (50 points | 5 comments)
3. Google open-sources the Pebble OS (746 points | 117 comments)
4. The Taylorator – All Your Frequencies Are Belong to Us (238 points | 73 comments)

6. The Alpha Myth: How captive wolves led us astray (162 points | 114 comments)

8. Go 1.24's go tool is one of the best additions to the ecosystem in years (135 points | 58 comments)
9. DeepSeek releases Janus Pro, a text-to-image generator [pdf] (629 points | 495 comments)
10. The ocean teems with networks of interconnected bacteria (94 points | 15 comments)

12. Dragonsweeper — A minesweeper game that requires observation (45 points | 27 comments)
13. Complexity physics finds crucial tipping points in chess games (15 points | 1 comment)
14. Oliver Heaviside and the theory of transmission lines (2021) (226 points | 66 comments)
15. Facebook ban on discussing Linux? (458 points | 226 comments)

22. The Curious Case of Quentell (68 points | 5 comments)
23. Highlighting Parts of Lua as Bash (10 points | discuss)

25. SiFive's P550 Microarchitecture (139 points | 50 comments)
26. Mineral Oil Cooled PC (2014) (46 points | 48 comments)
27. Peanut Butter Day: Going Nuts over NIST's Standard Reference Peanut Butter (2016) (93 points | 53 comments)
28. A layoff fundamentally changed how I perceive work (887 points | 821 comments)
29. Openhaystack: Build 'AirTags' – track Bluetooth devices via Apple's network (422 points | 106 comments)
30. The future of Rebble (353 points | 20 comments)
